item.title: Hacking Portable Air Conditioners
item.description: I bought a couple EdgeStar AP14001HS portable air conditioners in April 2020, since I expect to spend most of the Summer at home. I'm not able to use window A/Cs here, though that would be the obvious choice for efficiency because all the hot parts remain outside.

item.title: NASA Astronauts Return Home in SpaceX's Crew Dragon Spacecraft
item.description:
They‚Äôre coming home! üåé
On Aug. 1, NASA astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley will depart from the International Space Station aboard SpaceX‚Äôs Dragon ‚ÄúEndeavour‚Äù spacecraft after their mission aboard our orbiting laboratory. Starting at 5:15 p.m. EDT, tune in for our live coverage to see the duo undock from the station and make their return back to planet Earth.

item.title: Sharing knowledge in a remote team, across timezones
item.description: ‚ÄúTrue innovation comes an intersection of a cross-pollination of roles and ideas‚Äù - Sunil, ex-CTO@Buffer I‚Äôve been working remotely at Buffer for 6 years now. As a software engineer, one of the critical skill I believe we should must have is being able to learn continuously. However, working in a fully distributed team, split accross 10+ timezones. I live in Asia (UTC +8) while most of my teammates live in the US or Europe.

item.title: Techniques for Difficult Team Members - dcaulfield
item.description: Leading a team is difficult ‚Äì it‚Äôs why people love or hate the job. Where a team member incorporates themselves into the people and culture around them, the team lead drives that assimilation and culture. They must understand that each person has a different personality, and therefore each team culture is different. If this wasn‚Äôt ‚Ä¶
